meanings.sent1: The old rug looked even dingier after the dog ran through the mud.
meanings.sent2: The dingier the windows, the less light can come through.
meanings.sent3: She tried to clean the dingier spots on her shoes, but they just wouldn't come off.
meanings.sent4: The dingier the mirror, the more distorted your reflection becomes.
meanings.sent5: The dingier the room, the more it felt like a forgotten corner of the house.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear and age
meanings.sent1: His dingier jacket had patches sewn on to cover the holes.
meanings.sent2: The dingier the book, the more stories it seemed to hold within its pages.
meanings.sent3: The dingier the toy, the more it became a cherished childhood memory.
meanings.sent4: The dingier the map, the more adventures it had guided them through.
meanings.sent5: The dingier the photograph, the more nostalgic it made her feel.

meanings.sent1: The dingier the paint color, the less inviting the room appeared.
meanings.sent2: Her dingier smile didn't quite reach her eyes.
meanings.sent3: The dingier the flowers, the more they wilted in the vase.
meanings.sent4: The dingier the sky, the more ominous the storm clouds looked.
meanings.sent5: The dingier the fruit, the less appetizing it seemed to be.
